item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee
Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

cdata.text: This bill excludes locality-based comparability payments from the calculation of retirement and disability annuities for new employees in the Federal Employeesâ€™ Retirement System. (General schedule and certain other federal employees receive locality-based comparability payments when their official worksite is located in a geographic area with a pay disparity between federal and non-federal workers of more than 5%.)

bill.title: A bill to exclude locality adjustments from average pay for purposes of computing the amount of retirement annuities of new employees.

item.title: A bill to exclude locality adjustments from average pay for purposes of computing the amount of retirement annuities of new employees.
A bill to exclude locality adjustments from average pay for purposes of computing the amount of retirement annuities of new employees.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
